root: ^Oh, God... I can't believe he's gone. [Sam blows his nose loudly into a handerkerchief, sopping wet with tears].

s: ^I'm really sorry, sir, but I have to ask you some questions...
^It pains me to see such a handsome man cry. (flirt)
^Ask him if it's a bad time.

Time: ^I... just give me a moment. I'll pull myself together. Wee little Jimmy... gone.
Ask: ^Aye, I don't know if I'll be of any help in this state. [He sobs loudly into the handerkerchief again].
Comfort: ^And why should I be comforted in a time like this?
Calm: ^Alright, alright. Just give me a moment. [Slowly, he pulls himself together].
Solve: ^Aye, that I could! [He brightens a bit, wringing out the handerkerchief].
Questions: ^How can I be of assistance, Detective?

s: ^Where were you on the night of murder?
^What do you think of Delilah Winters?
^What do you think of Toby Wilson?

Self: ^I'm Mr. Willoughby's butler. Not much else to say, I'm afraid.

s: ^There has to be something more to you.
^Oh, come on, what do you do for fun?
^You know what they say about butlers...

Duties: ^Cleaned, cooked, took care of the house, served the guests - guess I was a bit more than a butler, doin' the tasks of a cook and all...

s: ^Ask him if he knows how to bake.
^Ask him if he served any suspicious guests lately.
^Ask him if he enjoyed being Mr. Willoughby's butler.

Bake: ^Oh, a little here and there. Quite a sweet tooth, Jimmy had.

s: ^Why do you address him so familiarly?

Pies: ^Oh, I haven't bake a pie in years! We usually get pastries from the bakery - too time consuming. I don't usually have time to bake, and we have the money for takeout.
Familiar: ^Been his butler for some 25 odd years, see. View him almost as my own son. I was so proud of him too... and now he's gone...
Guests: ^Ah, nobody really around except me, Delilah and that fellow Toby... he's the most suspicious of the lot.

c-0: ^Jimmy's client, see. On trial for mudering his wife... unpleasant fellow. Not a good guest.
^Prone to angry outbursts, messy... just, unpleasant, to be around.

Enjoy: ^Enjoy? Nay, I loved it! A good boss and a good man... almost like a son to me.

s: ^Ask him how long he's known Willoughby.
^Ask him what he did before becoming a butler.

c-0: ^Almost 25 odd years. Served his father, too. Lovely fellow.

s: ^Ask him what he did before becoming a butler.

Before: ^Oh, nothing pretty. Was in with a bad crowd, I was. That's all behind me now... far in the past.

c-0: ^Mobsters, criminals, that sort of thing... the Willoughbys took me out of that life, you know... they provided protection. I owe them my life.

s: ^I like a man with a past. (flirt)

c-0: ^Then I've got all that to offer you.

Live: ^Aye, lived with him the spare room, the one with the garden on the balcony.

c-0: ^Known him much of his life. Like my own son... a good lad. Saves money, besides.

Garden: ^Aye, I do! [He brightens at the mention of it]. It's really one of my only hobbies. So calming and peaceful...
Hobbies1: ^I used to crochet, but now the only other one besides gardening is staying fit!

s: ^Ask him more about his work outs.

Workouts: ^It's always important to stay strong, no matter your age. You've got to be able to protect yourself if need be.
Poisons: ^Why, yes.... I actually grew lillies.... funny, I remember some of them being cut the other day, when I haven't cut them in weeks!

s: ^Point out lillies were used to kill Willoughby.
^Ask him if he thinks someone broke in.
^Ask him if he had any other hobbies.

Lillies: ^Oh... oh no... I as good as killed him.

s: ^Ask him if he thought someone broke in.

In: ^Broke in? At the time I thought it was an animal but... oh, I've as good as killed him!

s: ^Ask him if he knows lillies were the murder weapon.

More: ^Well, it might surprise ya to know... but I have quite a past.
Past: ^I used to run with a shady crowd, that I did... I was young and desperate. My father died, and I inherited all his debts. I did terrible things to protect myself and my siblings. But they... I wasn't strong enough to keep them safe. So I vowed to protect the Willoughbys, as a thank you for getting me out of that life... and yet I've failed...

c-1: ^It's hard not to, in times like these.
c-2: ^Your paltry words can't comfort me, Detective... I thank you for the gesture.

Crowd: ^They were the mob, ya see... organized criminals and all that shit. Only reason they haven't gone after me is because Willoughby does them favors... like representin' them in court.
Represent: ^Oh, the mobsters themselves were fine but the people.... he got death threats, my Jimmy!

s: ^Would those death threats be the cause?

c-0: ^That was years ago. Most likely not.

Fun: ^Well, a man like me doesn't get a lot o' free time... but I suppose I mostly garden and workout...
Plant: ^Aye, I love it... it's so peaceful and calming. Grow all sorts of things out there, on the balcony.
Workouts2: ^It's always important to stay strong, no matter your age. You've got to be able to protect yourself if need be.
Alibi: ^I was out at a baby shower, of my friends, though to start from the beginning:
^Jimmy turned in early for the night, at around 6 o'clock. Said he'd had too much to drink. Oh... god... he might have already been poisoned then.

c-0: ^Oh... how terrible... poor Jimmy... my own boy...

s: ^Tell him to get on with the story.
^Ask him to continue on with the story.

c-3: ^Never! He was like a son to me...

s: ^You weren't the one hand him the poison.
^You don't have to be alone through this. (flirt)

c-1: ^Are you trying to accuse me of something?
c-2: ^I would like a shoulder to cry on...

s: ^Ask him to continue with the story.

Story: ^I left soon after he went to sleep - to go to an old friends' daughter's baby shower. They're naming me the godfather of their child, you know... she's going to be a little girl...
Friend: ^You know those shady folks I was friends with in my youth... turns out they're still just folks. Good folks, some of them. There's no shame in keeping up with old friends.

s: ^Ask him to tell you what else happened that night.
^Ask about the rest of the night.

c-1: ^Never! Jimmy was like my own son.

s: ^Ask about the rest of the night.

After: ^I go out drinking with this friend and come back here around 11 o'clock, dead tired and ready to go to bed, when I see commotion... all these cop cars around and Toby Wilson talking to them and Delilah running up from across the street.... and Jimmy... Jimmy...

s: ^So Toby was first on the scene?
^Ask him for proof of his alibi.

c-0: ^Aye, that he was... I wonder what he was doing there.

Skulk: ^I don't know... he's been skulking round, all suspicious-like these past few days, bothering Willoughby about his legal fees... oh, God... I should have known.

s: ^Ask him for proof of his alibi.
^Ask him for proof of his alibi.

Proof: ^[He holds out an invitation to a baby shower and a bar reciept. They are so waterlogged as to be almost illegible]. Here.
Enemies: ^Lawyers have many enemies, aye. Especially defense lawyers like Jimmy. Some people are walking free today because of him. And some other people don't really like that. Not one bit.
Spec: ^Well, there was this whole mess a few years ago... Jimmy defended a member of the mob, you see. It was a scary time! Getting death threats from the mail. Someone even tried to kill Jimmy!
Mother: ^The mother of the poor sod his client supposedly murdered... he didn't, of course, got off free... but yes, she tried to stab him when he was getting groceries. I've always been the one to grocery shop ever since.

s: ^Do you think she could have tried again and succeeded this time?

Try: ^Ah, no... it's been about three years. The woman who tried to kill him is dead herself anyway... poor dear.

c-0: ^Please, Detective, what more do I have to say for you to believe me? I didn't kill Jimmy!

Why: ^Toby's his client, see, and he's not very happy with ole Jim trying creative ways to get him off free instead of straight lying... he won't listen to wisdom! Jimmy could get disbarred...

c-0: ^I wouldn't put it past him. A shifty fellow.

Anger: ^He's very angry, actually. Quite angry. Jimmy wants to raise the price for the trouble he's gone through and the time he's had to take - stated in the contract, in fact - and that Mr. Wilson fellow is furious about it. Calling at hours of the night, skulking around our home... oh, God. He killed him.

s: ^A brilliant mind for a beautiful man! (flirt)

c-0: ^Just.... I know it in my heart.
c-1: ^The evidence is stacking up against him.

c-0: ^If I am anything, I am honest.

c-3: ^Thanks, but now is not the time, Detective. [He blushes anyway].

Willoughby: ^Such a kind soul, such a brilliant mind... I can't believe he's gone. And it's all my fault, my fault!

s: ^Why do you feel it's your fault?

c-1: ^Oh, please! I saw him as my own son!

Faults: ^I was supposed to protect him! I was supposed to keep him safe! And look at him now.
Protect: ^To tell yer the truth, my shady days aren't as far behind me as I made it seem...

s: ^So you're still working for the mob?

Mob: ^In a sense. Not an official member or anything anymore, but Jimmy gave them his legal council for cheap in exchange for information to keep him safe... and my services. Don't worry, now I'm only on Jimmy's payroll.

c-0: ^No, none that I can think of right now. It's an unprecedented peace in the criminal underworld right now in this city...

Bodyguard: ^I'm not only a butler... I'm a kind of bodyguard. It's why I work out so much.

s: ^So you're still working for the mob?

Pay: ^Aye, all I vcould ever dream and more. I wouldn't kill him for money. In fact, I'm worse off now than I've ever been.... now he's dead.

c-0: ^Thanks for the kind words, Detective... [He sniffles, loudly].

Duty: ^I keep anyone who wants kill him from killing him... clearly I've failed.

c-1: ^The mob gives us information, I provide the skills and he provides cheap legal council.

Blame: ^Why not? It was my duty to protect him... and I failed so terribly.

s: ^You weren't the one to poison himself.
^You shouldn't have to go through this alone. (flirt)

c-1: ^And it wasn't good enough! [It seems you have only succeeded in upsetting him further].
c-2: ^I could use your shoulder to lean on.

Know: ^Aye, knew him since was young. Like my own son. Watched him grow from a curious kid to a brilliant young man... he's been taken from us far too soon.
Fight: ^As much as any father and son. In fact, we were fighting a few days ago, a big, blowout kind of fight. Luckily we made up before he died... I couldn't live with the knowledge his last impression of me was anger.

s: ^Ask him what the fight was about.

Drop: ^I was trying to convince him he should drop Toby as a client. Too much trouble, that one.

s: ^Why did you want him to drop Toby?
^Ask why he wanted to drop Toby.

Down: ^He has an impossible case, an unstable personality, and was causing a whole fuss about Jimmy wanting to raise legal fees on him! It was all in the contract he signed. And not to mention how he's been skulking around recently... gives me the creeps.

c-1: ^Aye, almost as if he were casing the joint.... oh, God.

Delilah: ^A lovely girl, efficient, though perhaps not the best typist... but with more to her than meets the eye.

s: ^What do you mean, more to her than meets the eye?

Eye: ^I probably shouldn't say, but this is a murder investigation...

c-0: ^I've seen her... carrying on... behind all our backs... with Toby Wilson!

Affair: ^Aye, I saw the two of them making fools of themselves one day. I think they saw me - jerked away at the sight of my shadow. I always thought she had better taste than that.

s: ^Did she maybe think it was someone else?

Taste: ^Toby's an odious fellow, a sly little bastard. I don't know what she sees in him.

s: ^Unlike you... I know what someone would see in you. (flirt)

Knowledge: ^Aye, I reckon so, from the way she jerked away from him when I saw them makin' fools of themselves... I think they saw my shadow on the wall. Not as sneaky as I used to be. Funny, she hasn't confronted me about it...

s: ^Do you think she thought it was someone else?

c-1: ^Aye, a meek little lassie, that one.

s: ^Ask if she thought it was someone else.

c-0: ^Nay, but there have been bigger surprises.

s: ^Ask if she thought it was someone else.

Someone: ^Maybe... I don't know... maybe she thought it was Jimmy. We do have a similar build, after all...

s: ^Would she kill him if he found out?

c-0: ^Seems too sweet to. Then again, there have been bigger surprise twists...

Husband: ^Aye, but that poor little husband of hers can't keep up. Always fiddling with his medicines.

s: ^Did he know a lot about poisons?

c-0: ^He did... but not her. Though he's hapless enough she could use him, that's for sure...

Typist: ^We were going to have her take a class... a little slow in the fingers, that's all. Nothing terrible. I hope she didn't think we were going to fire her, poor girl...

s: ^Do you think she would kill Willoughby if she was fired?
^Did she ever argue with him over it?

c-0: ^I don't know... I don't think so... but people can surprise you.

Clash: ^Oh, not really... she was very polite, if a little distant. More prone to tears than anger.

c-0: ^Oh, no... though people can surprise you.

Toby: ^Oh, I do not like that fellow at all.
Dislike: ^A vile fellow - so rude to our staff at all times! Yelling at poor Delilah and me at all hours of the day, hanging around to bother Jimmy... broke all the time, a nightmare!

c-0: ^His client. On trial for murdering his wife, see.

s: ^Ask about how the trial is going.

Going: ^Not well... the evidence is piling up against him. With his training in poisons from the army... his wife was poisoned with lillies, see... he was unaccounted for in the hours she was poisoned. Not looking good.

s: ^Was that why he was so angry at Willoughby?

Angry: ^Jimmy's always had a clause in contract where he can raise fees if the client causes him trouble... and Jimmy's tantrums and the tough case made that clause happen. Toby wasn't very happy about that. Should have read the fine print!

s: ^Do you think he would have killed Willoughby over it?

c-0: ^I wouldn't put it past him... though it would be stupid to kill the only lawyer who would take on your case. Toby Wilson's not known for his brains!

Broke: ^He's a compulsive gambler, that Toby... he tries to deny it, but he has so many debts... it's part of why the case with his wife's so terrible. He took out life insurance on her in the weeks leading up to her death... quite suspicious, I say.

s: ^How do you know about the gambling?
^Did he have any money to gain from Willoughby's death?

Gamble: ^Seen him at a casino, I have... parlor owned by my shady old friends. He's no good at cards.

s: ^Did he have any money to gain from Willoughby's death?

Death: ^He had only paid the down payment on the fees. It would have lifted quite a lot of financial pressure.
Business: ^All the money in 'em, I think he funnels out too, into that awful habit. I've heard of army guys coming back wrong... I think he may be one of them.

s: ^Did he have money to gain from Willoughby's death?

Violent: ^I haven't seen it personally, but I wouldn't put it past him. He has that hitman's look in his eye. And a knowledge of poisons from the war to be sure...
Tillow: ^Often. Especially in these last few weeks... the evidence has been piling up against Toby - he's on trial for murdering his wife, see... in a remarkably similar manner to Jimmy... oh, God.

s: ^Did he have any reason to kill Willoughby

c-0: ^Aye, so he did. With lillies... How coincidental.

s: ^Did he have any reason to kill Willoughby?

Aggressive: ^Aye... yelling at Delilah and me all the time, hanging around to catch poor Jimmy when he was just trying to sleep, or, god forbid, read! Poor man... strange, how he yelled at Delilah like she was nothing him.

s: ^Did he have a motive to kill Willoughby?

c-0: ^They've been having an affair! I've seen it.

s: ^Did he have a reason to kill Willoughby?

Reason: ^Jimmy wanted to raise the prices of his legal fees - it was all in the contract. Toby disagreed with it. He was upset, too, because Jimmy wouldn't lie on his behalf in court - he thought it would be efficient to lie, but Jimmy could be disbarred!

s: ^Do you think Toby wanted to "disbar" Willoughby?
